text: Hello again my little worm friends!

I’m looking after the baby worms today because
Mrs Worm has had to go to Worm City to work.

They’re snug and cosy underground at the
moment, but if you see any of them poke their

heads out of the soil will you shout and tell
me please?

Right, let’s get to work and dig for some
letters!
here’s a P! p p p!

P is for Pumpkin! Oooh, we love carving pumpkins
at Halloween!
woah, what’s that noise?
P is for Plane!
Oink Oink - it’s a Pig! Hello Piggy.
What? There’s a baby worm behind me? Where?
I can’t see her!
Right, let’s look for another letter.
Here’s a Q!! Q Q Q!

Q is for Queen. This is the Queen of Wormland
- Queen Wormette the 4th. Your majesty!!

Q is for Quilt. This will keep me warm at
night!
Q is for Question mark!
More babies?? Where?

Are you tricking me?? I can’t see my babies
anywhere!

I’m going back underground to look for another
letter!
It’s a R. R R R!

R is for Rabbit! We both live underground
don’t we Mr Rabbit.

R is for Ring! OOh, what a pretty diamond
ring that is!

R is for Rocket. I’ve always wanted to fly
in a rocket.
hup
I’ve found a S inside here. S is for Star!!

Woo that was AMAZING!! I was the first worm
in space!
S is also for Snake.

S is for Spoon! That’s what you use to eat
your breakfast cereal with.

Oh there you are worms. Have you been popping
up behind me this whole time!! Are you hungry?

Let’s just have a quick look at some of
the words we’ve learned today.
We’ve learned P Q R S

Pumpkin
Plane
Pig

Queen
Quilt
Question Mark

Rabbit
Ring
Rocket

Star
Snake
Spoon

Right, come on kids. It’s time we went downstairs
for some dinner. See you next time!
Byeeeeee
